Package parser

Class SimpleTokenizer

java.lang.Object
parser.SimpleTokenizer
public class SimpleTokenizer
extends java.lang.Object
Chops up a single string then reconstructs: (1) Strings based on double quotes (2) Chars based on single quotes (3) Slash single characters e.g. [\,"] -> [\"] (4) reconstructs a comment into a single line

  • Constructor Details

    • SimpleTokenizer

      public SimpleTokenizer()

  • Method Details

    • tokenizeString

      public java.lang.String[] tokenizeString​(java.lang.String arrLineIn)
      Returns a tokenized string in the form of a array of strings. Empty string returned as a empty string. How this works: (1) First string is split up based on split regex (2) argument line is converted into a array list (3) Single quotes are reconstructed (4) Slash characters are reconstructed (5) Double quotes are reconstructed (6) Array primitive is returned

    • getColumnFragment

      public int getColumnFragment​(int in)
      Returns the string fragment index of a column number segment. -1 means there is a error. Example: 1:|" FOOBAR"| 2:|"IF X"| column 1 = " FOOBAR" -> string segment 1:[" "] 1:["FOOBAR"] 0 and 1 in would both return 1 since they belong the column 1 segments.

    • isFirstCharAComment

      private boolean isFirstCharAComment​(java.lang.String in)
      Checks whether the first character of a string is a comment character meaning that this is a comment string which returns true.

    • splitStringIntoColumns

      private void splitStringIntoColumns​(java.util.List out, java.lang.String in, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> columnLens)

    • lfs

      private void lfs​(java.lang.String in, java.util.List out, int columnIndex)
      Lazy Full string-split This cuts a column into segments and retains segment to column index. TODO: Should be able to define in the JSON how this splitting should happen on a column basis? what if we wanted to only split string a specific regex at a specific column?

    • fullSplit

      private void fullSplit​(java.util.List arrayList)
      Tokenizes a string completely based on a split string regex then reconstructs the string back to expected results.

    • reconstructSingleQuotes

      private void reconstructSingleQuotes​(java.util.List al)
      Reconstruct single quotes: (1) [',a.'] -> ['a'] (2) [',\,"'] -> ['\"']

    • getSingleQuote

      private java.lang.String getSingleQuote​(int n, int i, java.util.List al)
      Return string after reading between i the start of the index, and n the look ahead amount.

    • CheckNAhead

      private boolean CheckNAhead​(int n, int i, java.util.List al)
      Check if the string after the index i based on the n look ahead amount. If each string is 1 in length then return true.

    • CheckNAheadForSlash

      private boolean CheckNAheadForSlash​(int n, int i, java.util.List al)
      Check if the string after the index i based on the n look ahead amount. If each string is 1 in length and the first one is a \ then return true.

    • reconstructSlashChars

      private void reconstructSlashChars​(java.util.List al)
      Reconstructs slash chars into a single string. E.g., [\,"] -> [\"]

    • reconstructDoublequotes2

      private void reconstructDoublequotes2​(java.util.List al)
      Reconstructs double quotes into single strings. NOTE: The string policy is: (1) [",XXXXX,"][][",YYYYY,"] -> ["XXXXX"][]["YYYYY"] (2) [;][",XXX,"]["YYY"] -> [;][",XXX,"]["YYY"] | Ignores the comment (3) [",X,;,Y"][][;,X,Y] -> ["X;Y"][][;,",X,",Y] | creates string if comment is withing strings but ignores a string at start of comment

    • getDobuleQuoteString

      private java.lang.String getDobuleQuoteString​(int startIndex, int endIndex, java.util.List al)
      Returns a string based on a range between the start index and end index of a double quote found

    • findStartIndex

      private int findStartIndex​(java.util.List al, boolean stopIF, int[] look4Toggle)
      Finds the index of the first double quote Returns -1 if there is not double quote found or a comment character is found.

    • findEndIndex

      private int findEndIndex​(int startIndex, java.util.List al, int[] look4Toggle)
      Finds the index of the next double quote. Returns -1 if there is no double quote found.

    • yeetComment

      public void yeetComment​(java.util.List al)
      Reconstructs everything at the start of a comment to the end of line. i.e. yeets the comment

    • isCommentRegexMatch

      private boolean isCommentRegexMatch​(java.lang.String string)
      Returns true if a string matches a comment regex
